reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 12 night stay at this lovely hotel. We had booked a prestige suite - the suite is on two floors with the upper floor on the roof with sunbeds and jacuzzi - and were shown to a lovely room on the side of the hotel overlooking the river and St Eulalia. Unfortunately the smell from the river was terrible so we moved to another room in another block. We have been told that the river is due to be dredged to prevent this smell In future. It was a lovely room with a staircase up to a roof terrace complete with hot tub - see photos. The bed was very comfortable but sadly at about 6am the next morning a disco started in the next room!! We complained and were moved again this time to room 2409. At last we settled in. There were a few niggles with the room but overall it was very good. The bed was very comfortable and there was an amazing shower. The massage bath wasn't very comfortable and quite difficult to get in and out of.
reviews.title: Great hotel with wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The housekeeping was excellent. Everything was clean and fresh and the prestige suite has the benefit of a turndown service and that was excellent too.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Spa is excellent and the massages are amazing. I think it's a good thing there is a charge for using the spa. If it was free it would be packed out and certainly not very relaxing. If you book a treatment you only pay an extra 10 Euros to use the spa and you could stay in there all day!
reviews.title: Taste of Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet the first night was disappointing. The plates were cold and so was a lot of the food. We did complain and this was corrected by the following evening. We are not buffet people but there was certainly a good choice and a cooking station for fresh meat and fish. Breakfast is very good.
reviews.title: excellent hotel with amazing staff

reviews.text: Do try La Vinoteca and Monsson the two a la carte restaurants in the hotel. If you are on half board you only have to pay a €20 supplement per person. The food is out of this world and must be some of the best food on the Island. We ate there six times during our stay.
reviews.title: Top Class but very expensive

reviews.text: good points such as kids club, breakfast,pool and layout of hotel. not a 5 star but more a 4 star. paid 1000 euro a night for 2 rooms connecting which was very expensive but being august you almost pay and smile. Had a nice hgoliday but could have been better for the money paid.Now bad points. No turn down service for a 5 star hotel! filthy rooms when you looked behind curtains and sofas, in fact too horrid to describe. useless concierge that never lets you know if anything was in fact booked. Wanted to charge my family to use the indoor pool in the spa (100 eur). I did not pay. AC problems and wow was that an issue in August. No free water in room is shameful in this day and age. Wrote to general manager on issues and he never replied. worst of all was a guest having his rolex stolen from spa and it was locked in the changing room. someone broke the lock and stole it. Yikes!
reviews.title: Family of 5 visit to Insotel August 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back in the Uk from a 4 day stay. We were greeted by a very efficient and freindly lady at reception, and were delighted to be offered an upgraded room to a fourth floor prestige suite complete with roof top hot tub and daybeds.The Hotel was impeccably clean and staff very freindly.Breakfast was a delight with a vast selection of food to suit all.
reviews.title: Enjoyable brief stay

reviews.text: Would have expected water in the room on a daily basis considering paying 5 star prices.The air conditioning is so quiet but efficient and combined with the black out blinds ensured a good nights sleep
reviews.title: A hotel we all enjoyed

reviews.text: Biggest problem was the pool sunbeds, they are far too uncomfortable without matresses.
reviews.title: Just not quite excellent

reviews.text: Apart from that thank you for an enjoyable stay
reviews.title: Great hotel for a sun vacation, but mixed feelings....

reviews.text: My response to how our holiday was is "lovely". Would we return? Possibly. I did feel whilst there that there were two or three things that needed tweaking. Strangely the beds didn't bother us that much and you could always get one and the pool is the best we have ever seen. Always warm and clean.
reviews.title: Quiet and relaxing Ibiza
4,5 but not 5
reviews.text: The breakfast is awesome. The cleanliness of the whole place is brilliant however some days housekeeping were so late a siesta really wasn't possible if we wanted the room cleaned. The staff were, for the most part, very efficient. I should mention Jane on reception who was so helpful. As a family we felt that the staff were ruthlessly efficient and as there were a lot of German guests and a corporate event on they seemed more geared up for them rather than for more laid back Brits. We found it difficult to be understood on a number of occasions.

There wasn't any entertainment for most of the week as the pianist wasnt there the week we visited. However as we walked into town each evening it didn't matter too much and you could hear the music from the beach bar just outside the hotel grounds. And then just when we were thinking it was all a bit too corporate for us the dj and sax player appeared on the Friday afternoon. Wow. What a difference that made. Some fellow Brits were leaving that afternoon and they were reluctant to go as it was such a good afternoon. Very chilled.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all it is only a few niggly things that limit the grade for this hotel. It could be even better with a little more personality and some activity as at night there was hardly anyone around probably because as previous reviewers have said the price of the drinks are so high.
reviews.title: perfect for a relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a quiet Ibiza holiday in 5* surroundings this is the place to go.
reviews.title: Bad Backs and sunbeds

reviews.text: We first stayed at the hotel 6 years ago so our return was with interest to see if it was still as good. We need not have worried, it is still a lovely hotel which despite near to capacity was quiet and there was always a sun bed (they are not the most comfortable but are going to be replaced next year). All the staff were courteous and attentive and the food was excellent.
reviews.title: An oasis of tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our stay it was my 50th birthday, the staff were aware and left me a birthday cake in our room with a congratulation letter, this was a nice touch and shows they are keen to please.
reviews.title: First class hotel

reviews.text: I have read several comments on trip advisor criticizing the cost of the drinks which appear expensive 9 euros for a gin and tonic but it is more than a double measure as they just pour the gin in front of you without a measure!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, expensive food and drinks!

reviews.text: we booked with Sovereign holidays with a deal offering half board so did not appreciate the cost of the evening meal. At breakfast and diner the choice was overwhelming, fresh and well presented. we also ate at the poolside restaurant for lunch which was very good and the Japanese restaurant which offered great choice, very good service and came with a supplement of 20 euros.
reviews.title: Very Average/definitely not value for money!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was ready when we arrived 11am, spacious with a large balcony, wood floor was lifting but was not a problem. It would be good to have more than one English channel on the TV but it did not matter to us, water in the room is normally expected these days but was not provided, however, as it is free at breakfast we took a couple of bottles to our room.
reviews.title: Amazing! As always!
